00008 /**
00009  * rsa asymetric crypto related functions
00010  *
00011  * expects pem-style rsa-keys as 'vendors/rsakeys/pub.pem' and
00012  * 'vendors/rsakeys/priv.pem'. You can change the path by
00013  * setKeyPath()
00014  *
00015  *
00016  * @package kata_utility
00017  * @author joachim.eckert@gameforge.de
00018  * @author feldkamp@gameforge.de
00019  */
00020 class RsaUtility {
00021 
00022     function __construct() {
00023         if (!function_exists('openssl_public_encrypt')) {
00024             throw new Exception('openssl extension not loaded :(');
00025         }
00026 
00027         $this->setKeyPath('vendors' . DS . 'rsakeys' . DS);
00028         $this->setEncoder('json');
00029     }
00030 
00031     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00032 
00033     /**
00034      * filesystem path to key storage
00035      * @var string
00036      */
00037     private $keyPath = '';
00038 
00039     /**
00040      * read current filesystem path for key storage
00041      * @return string
00042      */
00043     public function getKeyPath() {
00044         return ROOT . $this->keyPath;
00045     }
00046 
00047     /**
00048      * set filesystempath where to find keys
00049      * @param string $path
00050      */
00051     public function setKeyPath($path) {
00052         $this->keyPath = str_replace(ROOT, '', $path);
00053     }
00054 
00055     /**
00056      * storage for priv/pub key
00057      * @var array
00058      */
00059     private $keys = array();
00060 
00061     /**
00062      * read key from filesystem
00063      * @param string $what can be 'pub' or 'priv'
00064      * @return string
00065      */
00066     public function getKey($what) {
00067         if (('pub' != $what) && ('priv' != $what)) {
00068             throw new Exception('$what can only be "pub" or "priv". typo?');
00069         }
00070 
00071         if (!empty($this->keys[$what])) {
00072             return $this->keys[$what];
00073         }
00074 
00075         if (!file_exists($this->getKeyPath() . $what . '.pem')) {
00076             throw new Exception('Cant find ' . $what . '.pem in ' . $this->getKeyPath());
00077         }
00078         $key = file_get_contents($this->getKeyPath() . $what . '.pem');
00079         if (!empty($key)) {
00080             $this->keys[$what] = $key;
00081             return $key;
00082         }
00083         throw new Exception('Cant read ' . $what . '.pem in ' . $this->getKeyPath());
00084     }
00085 
00086     /**
00087      * return our public key
00088      * @return string
00089      */
00090     public function getPublicKey() {
00091         return $this->getKey('pub');
00092     }
00093 
00094     /**
00095      * return our private key
00096      * @return string
00097      */
00098     public function getPrivateKey() {
00099         return $this->getKey('priv');
00100     }
00101 
00102     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00103 
00104     /**
00105      * which de/encoder function to use
00106      * @var string
00107      */
00108     private $encoder = 'json';
00109 
00110     /**
00111      * set de/encoder function. can be (for examle) json,base64 etc
00112      * @param string $encoder
00113      */
00114     public function setEncoder($encoder) {
00115         if (null === $encoder) {
00116             $this->encoder = null;
00117             return;
00118         }
00119 
00120         $encoder = strtolower($encoder);
00121         if (!function_exists($encoder . '_encode') || !function_exists($encoder . '_decode')) {
00122             throw new Exception($encoder . '_encode/decode not found');
00123         }
00124 
00125         $this->encoder = $encoder;
00126     }
00127 
00128     /**
00129      * read currently used de/encoder function
00130      * @return string
00131      */
00132     public function getEncoder() {
00133         return $this->encoder;
00134     }
00135 
00136     /**
00137      * encode given string using currently set encoder function
00138      * @param string $data
00139      * @return string
00140      */
00141     public function encode($data) {
00142         if (null === $this->encoder) {
00143             return $data;
00144         }
00145 
00146         $func = $this->encoder . '_encode';
00147         return $func($data);
00148     }
00149 
00150     /**
00151      * decode given string using currently set decoder function
00152      * @param string $data
00153      * @return string
00154      */
00155     public function decode($data) {
00156         if (null === $this->encoder) {
00157             return $data;
00158         }
00159         if ('json' == $this->encoder) {
00160             return json_decode($data, true);
00161         }
00162 
00163         $func = $this->encoder . '_decode';
00164         return $func($data);
00165     }
00166 
00167     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00168 
00169     /**
00170      * encrypts data asymetrically
00171      *
00172      * first serializes the data, then encrypts it and finally base64-encodes it
00173      * best used to crypt data which can be decrypted with decryptAsymetric()
00174      *
00175      * @param mixed $data:           the data to encrypt
00176      * @param mixed $receiverPubKey: the public key of the receiver
00177      * @param mixed $ownPrivKey:     own private key, needed if data should also be signed (defaults to null)
00178      * @param bool  $sign:           true if signature should be added (defaults to false)
00179      *
00180      * @return mixed: the encrypted data, false on error
00181      */
00182     public function encrypt($data, $receiverPubKey, $sign = false) {
00183         $crypted = null;
00184         $signature = null;
00185 
00186         if (!openssl_public_encrypt(serialize($data), $crypted, $receiverPubKey)) {
00187             return false;
00188         }
00189 
00190         // get signature
00191         if ($sign) {
00192             $signature = $this->getSignature($crypted);
00193             if ($signature === false) {
00194                 return false;
00195             }
00196         }
00197 
00198         $crypted = $this->encode($crypted);
00199 
00200         // add signature
00201         if (!empty($signature)) {
00202             $crypted .= "|$signature";
00203         }
00204 
00205         return $crypted;
00206     }
00207 
00208     /**
00209      * decrypts asymetric crypted data
00210      * first base64-decodes it, then decrypts it and finally unserializes it
00211      * best used to decrypt data encrypted with encryptAsymetric()
00212      *
00213      * @param string $data:           the encrypted data
00214      * @param mixed  $senderPubKey:   the public key of the sender, needed for signature check (defaults to null)
00215      * @param bool   $checkSignature: true if signature should be checked (defaults to false)
00216      *
00217      * @return mixed: the decrypted data, false on error
00218      */
00219     public function decrypt($data, $senderPubKey = null, $checkSignature = false) {
00220         $data = explode("|", $data);
00221         $data[0] = base64_decode($data[0]);
00222         if ($data[0] == false) {
00223             return false;
00224         }
00225 
00226         $ownPrivKey = $this->getPrivateKey();
00227 
00228         // verify signature
00229         if ($checkSignature) {
00230             if (empty($senderPubKey) || empty($data[1]) || !$this->verifySignature($data[0], $data[1], $senderPubKey)) {
00231                 return false;
00232             }
00233         }
00234 
00235         $decrypted = null;
00236         if (!openssl_private_decrypt($data[0], $decrypted, $ownPrivKey)) {
00237             return false;
00238         }
00239 
00240         return unserialize($decrypted);
00241     }
00242 
00243     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00244 
00245     /**
00246      * generates an asymetric signature
00247      *
00248      * @param string $data:          the data to sign
00249      * @param mixed  $ownPrivateKey: the own private key to sign the data with
00250      *                               (as resource or pem representation)
00251      *
00252      * @return string: the signature (base64-encoded)
00253      */
00254     private function getSignature($data) {
00255         $signature = null;
00256         $ownPrivateKey = $this->getPrivateKey();
00257 
00258         if (!openssl_sign($data, $signature, $ownPrivateKey, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA1)) {
00259             return false;
00260         }
00261 
00262         return $this->encode($signature);
00263     }
00264 
00265     /**
00266      * verifies an asymetric signature
00267      *
00268      * @param string $data:            the data which has been signed
00269      * @param string $signature:       the signature to check (base64-encoded)
00270      * @param mixed  $senderPublicKey: the public key of the signing party
00271      *
00272      * @return bool: true if signature was correct, false if incorrect or other error
00273      */
00274     private function verifySignature($data, $signature, $senderPublicKey) {
00275         if (openssl_verify($data, base64_decode($signature), $senderPublicKey, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA1) !== 1) {
00276             return false;
00277         }
00278         return true;
00279     }
